Reviews.Title: “Not a five star”
Reviews.Author: YasminMontreal
Reviews.Content: This is more like a 3.5 star airport hotel on a very busy highway. The rooms are adequate though a bit on the old side. The hotel has an airport shuttle but for international travelers flying out very early, you have to take a cab which costs about 10 Turkish lira. On the whole, there are other better options than this.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Difficult Location”
Reviews.Author: Steven B
Reviews.Content: The title of the hotel says it all.... Conference and Airport. If you are staying for a conference at the hotel, obviously a good location. It is a 15~20 minute trip to the airport by the hourly minibus transfer. As it is hourly, don;t miss it! Otherwise, the rooms are decent sized, clean, good service. Front desk were helpful but lacking in any warmth.

Reviews.Title: “Hot bed”
Reviews.Author: Justin M
Reviews.Content: Only if your staying for the night would I come back here. Not satisfied with the 5 star rating AT ALL. The AC wouldn't work even after the repair guy came to fix it, the shower leaked all over the bathroom floor, the windows weren't sound proof so we could hear every airplane. When we told them about the problems they upgraded us to the Business suite which had it's own set of problems, the ironing board was not working, the heat would come on randomly and the auto power down would happen every 1.5 hours until we got up and moved around. The service was inaddaquate as well, they called us and told us to wait 2 min till they called back to fix the problems...after 15min I came down stairs to have a little face to face with reception. Normally I easy going, but when your paying for a 5 star hotel you expect the basics and then some. Pro's: Rooms are ok Con's: Slow service, small rooms, poor bathrooms, poor heating/cooling HVAC system, far from Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in concrete”
Reviews.Author: TheH0neym00ner
Reviews.Content: I guess most people staying at the Radisson airport hotel go there on business. The hotel's location is unsuitable for anything else! I travelled to Istanbul and stayed there for 5 nights in March 2012. On arrival I found the toilet in my room in awfull condition, with yellow stains on the seat and brown water at the bottom!!! Of course I reported it to the reception and they made sure it was properly cleaned. Other than that the hotel itself seems very good and complete, with spacious rooms, friendly staff, swimming pool and fitness center, and with a very good restaurant inside. However, despite all the luxury, it is realy just a big concrete block with no particular views - all I could see from my room was a 12-lane motorway folowed by the airport's runway (I think the other side is even worse). If you plan to travel downtown and maybe do some shopping you must avoid staying there because there is nothing worth seeing and doing around it. One night I took a taxi to the Bosphorus and took about 90 minutes to get there (a result of both the distance and the infamous Istanbul traffic). However if the purpose of your trip is situated near the airpot or the exhibitions around it, it is very convenient. Two things to have in mind are: a) in the evenings the motorway to and from the hotel is packed with cars, which is why many taxi drivers will NOT want to take you there and b) it is TOO close to the airport and the exhibitions, which again may result in taxi drivers not willing to take you for such a short distance. So overall a pretty good hotel but only as a stop-over or if your work is nearby. I wouldn't recomend it for anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Location is All it Has”
Reviews.Author: rogers222
Reviews.Content: Airport hotel where the airlines stash guests who were booked on flights that got cancelled. So even before you check in, you've already had a bad day. Typical warehouse-style airport hotel, with hundreds of cloned rooms. Room windows don't open, internet is super-slow and keeps disconnecting, food in the restaurant is abysmal, airline guests have to order off the "cheap" menu, room thermostats don't work. The only good thing about the hotel is that it's close to the airport and hopefully you only have to stay there one night. The room is very quiet, since there is no street noise this far out in the boondocks. No reason to stay there if you're not forced to do so by the airline.

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK”
Reviews.Author: uskuhlmans
Reviews.Content: My preference in Istanbul is to stay at one of the smaller hotels in Sultanamet, but this was a quick business stop and I found the hotel to be quite nice. It is located very near the airport so I am puzzled by those who complain of aircraft noise--comes with the territory. While on a main road, there are charming neighborhoods just behind the hotel, a few minutes walk away with shops and restaurants and a real sense of place. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was very good. The pool is small--don't try laps--but there is a well-appointed health club that is free to guests. Transport to the city is easy via the airport metro but requires some timing to not have to wail for the shuttle on the return. I had no trouble with the WiFi and was pleased that it was complimentary. Overall, for this trip, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you need to be near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: EduardoStruve Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need a comfortable hotel near the airport, the Radisson is a good choice. The Free Shuttle that runs every hour from and to airport is very convenience and easy to find, itâ€™s together with all Hotel Shuttles outside the disembark area. It takes around 10 minutes to reach the hotel. I got upgraded, since Iâ€™m a Club Carlson member, but the room seems to be similar to regular rooms. Mine was facing the internal garden. Not a good view and no privacy. If you are looking for personalized service, that is not your hotel. Itâ€™s very big and I could say that itâ€™s more for Conventions. The breakfast is good, with plenty of items. Internet was also complimentary and worked fine. The problem was to get power outlet adaptor. It took them half an hour to send me one, and they tried to charge, saying that the adaptorâ€™s to borrow were finished. I ask to talk to the manager and the problem was solved, no charges. They were also very kind to give me a late check out, since my flight was in the early evening. I would stay again if I need to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not at Radisson Blu standard”
Reviews.Author: Rouwen
Reviews.Content: Good thing first: it is just 5 minutes from "Ataturk" airport by hotel shuttle bus. All the rest hardly qualifies for anything above 2 stars. The room is filthy with stains everywhere (bed and floor). Air condition is not properly working and heated the room to sauna levels. Bathroom is ok. Despite promoting free Wifi, it is impossible to log in.TV is smaller than an average computer screen. The restaurant is serving mediocre food of allmost no taste. Bottom line: If you need a bed for transit close to Istanbul International Airport it might be an option - otherwise stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable despite the inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromhongkong
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when I joined a tour to Turkey during Christmas. The interior design is new and modern. The staff are friendly and they are very willing to offer help. Free wifi is provided. Though the rooms cannot be described as spacious, they are clean and cozy. The breakfast buffet is definitely up to western standard. Fried eggs and omelettes are served on request. As others have mentioned, since it is an airport hotel, it is quite far away from the city centre. As I remember, I was stuck in a traffic congestion despite the fact that I left the hotel for sightseeing in the city as early as 8am! Therefore, I would only suggest this hotel to those who plan to spend one day in Istanbul and will leave the city by flight in the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “perfect airport hotel - nice swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: FUNtravellerFUN
Reviews.Content: perfect airport hotel - nice swimming pool Stayed only one night to catch a morning flight I d certainly stay there again to get to the airport in the am as traffic in Istanbul is aweful and you might lose your flight. No view from the rooms The hotel is located on a very busy motorway leading to the Ataturk airport Comfortable room, big beds, quite well kept. Breakfast is so so Quite friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Very typical airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: callmeishmael
Reviews.Content: Embarrassingly enough, I stayed at this hotel by accident, intending to book at the Renaissance Polat instead, but then just decided to go with it once the reservation was made. It is a very average airport hotel in every way. They do have a free shuttle back and forth to the airport, but you must be lucky to catch it as it stops only once an hour at the international terminal only. The hotel told me every half hour when I called to enquire so thank goodness I caught it fairly quickly. Check in was a disaster as there was an entire lobby full of TK passengers they were accomodating whose flight must have been cancelled. Not the hotel's fault obviously, but the wait to check in was an eternity behind this group. The reception agent was however very pleasant when I got to the front. The room was adequate, but nothing particularly special. Dinner at the one restaurant in the hotel was subpar and the service was exceedingly slow, so that is a minus. Breakfast, as is typical of airport hotels, always seems to start long past the time folks need to be at the airport in the morning, so I didn't partake. In summary, this is a very no-frills, typical airport hotel charging high prices. I wouldn't not recommend it, but I think better accomodations can be had for overnights near Istanbul airport.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, Arrogant and Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Buldag
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel. The receptionist did not know English at all. Kept trying to talk to us in Arabic - even though we mentioned we didn't know Arabic. The rooms are large but bland. We got room service - food was cold and tasteless. Tomatoes were stale. Bathroom door did not lock properly. Carpet and couch upholstery had stains. We just wanted to close our eyes and sleep - so we could leave this dump in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Most pleasing”
Reviews.Author: docbob2596
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2 nights business. Its out of town, close to the airport, so handy for the short visit. A free shuttle bus operates which is most welcome. Wonderful boutique hotel with a lovely large foyer with open plan bar area. Very welcoming staff who went out of their way to help. A very nice room indeed, with all mod cons, including an individual nespresso coffee machine, however no kettle to make tea, and as always never enough sugar!.. I booked a business room, and the hotel has free wifi, however i was disappointed ot find the signal in my room , was useless, unless i sat in the bathroom or near the door. I mentioned this to the front desk next morning and found by evening they had done something to boost it a bit, enough that it was usable at the desk. I ate both nights in the bar, and the food was, as one expects in Turkey, just excellent. Wonderful service in the bar, and also in the restaurant.. Despite looking onto a 8 lane highway on its doorstep and an airport on the other side of that, soundproofing was brilliant, though the windows really could do with a clean!.. A most enjoyable stay and would not hesitate to use this hotel again,,,

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: ASO82
Reviews.Content: Pros: Well presented reception area, restaurants and bar Good selection at breakfast Free decent speed WiFi Very comfortable bed and pillows Cons: Heating did not work in room, only cold air Some of the decor in the rooms, notably in the bathroom was dated and a little grubby TV rather small. For a business hotel, you'd think the TV would be bigger as it would surely be used more than in a hotel aimed at tourists

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and convenient”
Reviews.Author: amitabhsinha
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel few times from month of June to Oct 2011. Covenient for Airport connections or if on Business at Airport and in Aviation. However,Far from Downtown and Tourist areas. By Taxi depending on trafiic can take anytime between 30 mins to 45 mins reach Taksim Square. Few Taxis have tieup with Hotel and are parked in front of Hotel and are easily available. For Airport transfer ,shuttle service is provided By the hour between hotel and Airport and vise versa. Many resturants are located near the hotel and Street behind the Hotel is full of Shops and closest Mall is 10 mins walk down the street. As highlighted in some of earler reviews the Noise level sometimes is high depending on the room you get. Besides located next to a busy road it also happens to be close to Takeoff path of Atatuk airports main runway. Returants and Breakfast served is good. The hotel also has a good gym, spa and Hamman. Overall a good hotel and with of fine Tuning can even better.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Friendly & Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: kmalho
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on business for 5 nights and the hotel is ideally located for the airport. Apparently there is an airport shuttle however it is not well signed at all at the airport so I took a taxi instead. The hotel is located just off a busy motorway and can be quite disturbing in the night if you have a room facing the street, although I didn't have a problem sleeping as the noise died down from about 8pm. The lobby and communal areas of the hotel are fantastic, very stylish and contemporary. The hotel gym, bar and conference center are extensively used by locals and events, so there is always people around to create an atmosphere but it's not overpowering. The rooms are fantastic, very large king beds and a lot of space to stretch out and make use of the entire room. The room service is good however the restaurant staff don't seem to have a clue what they are doing. Also, the selection is extremely limited for a top class hotel. The hotel is quite far from the Istanbul city center and would cost a little bit in taxi fares to and from there; however it is achievable if you're just staying in Istanbul for a couple of nights and want to visit the sights. And getting a taxi any time of day is very quick. The surrounding area of the hotel is nothing special and nothing for visitors, so you can feel pretty isolated here. I would recommend walking downhill 3-5 minutes and visiting the Turkish Sweet shop for your gifts and sweets to take home, very reasonable prices however they don't speak english so very difficult to understand what you're buying.

Reviews.Title: “"Yes we can" attitude....Sorry, it's no we can't..”
Reviews.Author: Jgelley
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay (2 rooms) here after our flight connections were changed last minute. The hotel (supposedly 5 star) runs a complimentary shuttle between the airport & the hotel (4km). I called the front desk to check timings from the airport to the hotel (we had a lot of luggage). Every hour, on the half hour I was informed. As we collected our luggage I called again and said that we were going to be at 35 mins past the hour, please ask the driver to wait for us just 5 mins...."get a taxi, its 15 YTL" she said & hung up! So, not a good start from a hotel group who's tag line is "Yes, we can". We had to take 2 taxi's due to luggage - cost 40YTL. Check in was labourious, seemingly a problem finding us 2 x twin rooms, even though this was what I had booked. The rooms were poor, the TV screen seriously, about 12" wide. There was no clock in the room - an airport hotel with no room clock!! - In the mini bar, a can of fizzy orange 12YTL (Â£4.00). we went to the bar (not a reataurant, just the bar) for lunch which took almost 40 mins to arrive, was cold or at very best, lukewarm and most of it, nothing like as described on the menu, for example, 'A crisp bagel with salmon & mediterreanean salad' was smoked salmon & limp lettuce with capers and, get this, english mustard, served on a soft bread roll. We left 50% of the food, it was awful, our general complaint met with a shrug - the cost of 4 sandwiches - 98YTL (Â£37.00). sadly, most of the staff we were in contact with were surly or unhelpful other than the luggage porter who deserved a medal. The internet connection was nothing short of a joke, the beds rock hard. I have tried hard to find some redeeming features about this hotel but I have to say, based on this experience, the only thing I can say is it's close to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere else in Istanbul and save your money”
Reviews.Author: BIGLAROttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayedk at this over priced hotel and was shocked by the lack of service. The wirelss internet in the hotel is barely working and has a decent signal only near the elevaror in one tower.... After complaining to the front desk and going down to visit them four times, I was told that they could only move me to a room with twin beds (do I look like two people????). Otherwise I would have to move my room to another tower and use a cable for the internet. I told them that I did not want this and that I was very unsatisified by such a shocking ommission in a hotel charging 135 Euro per night. I also asked for the Night Manager to call me. He never did, although I waited until 11:30 for the call...... The next day, I complained again to the front desk to see if I could be moved closer to the internet. They told me that the 2nd tower had wonderful wireless internet and that they would move me and upgrade my room. This is exactly the opposite of what the clerk on duty on Wednesday night told me..... Fool that I am, I packed up my room and moved to the new tower. Guess what, same poor wireless internet. The original room was actually quite nice and the upgraded room was not really much of an improvement. Funny how the staff all knew to ask the guests if they wanted to upgrade to business class rooms for and extra 45 Euro per night, but no one seems to know the shoddy state of their IT infastructure. I am writing now from a Wired Internet Cable connection and the internet speed is still incredibly slow. People, wake up!!!! Its 2011 and it is not difficult to get sufficient internet service for a hotel this size (certainly shouldn't be for the amount you charge for rooms...) and to provide wireless service which works in all rooms. In conclusion, the Place is filled with signs and cards advertising the 100% Guest Satisfaction Guarantee. Bold words, but no one is there to stand behind them when it matters. Next time its and IBIS hotel for me, where I know the accomodation and service will be better. This is a very sad commentary on a Radisson SAS hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deflumine
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel if you have to catch a flight. Very good service, very nice staff and very good facilities. They recognise you after your second visit, I was impressed. Yes I can is their motto!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: PK173
Reviews.Content: Stayed here following a hectic tour around Turkey. Was offered a Mezzanine Suite upgrade for 30 Euro. Well worth it. Very nice room. Decent bar and restaurant. Free broadband (a little slow, but hey) and complimentary shuttle to the airport. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business Hotel - avoid the street rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Claude C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here seveeral times, Nice business hotel, friendly staff, efficient rooms, Wifi signal in some rooms somewhat weak. Make sure you avoid the rooms facing this awful 6-8 lane road. Free hourly shuttle to the airport, from the airport difficult to find, taxi drivers act rather rude due to short trip to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: shell1952
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated very close to Ataturk airport and a free shuttle is provided to and from the airport. The shuttle from the airport leaves on the 1/2 hour and from the hotel to the airport, it leaves on the hour. You have to plan accordingly. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and assisted me in resolving billing issues. The hotel is nicely decorated, clean, the free internet worked well and the room was comfortable for 1 person. The food was pricey as was the bar. This hotel is not in a good location if you are coming here for vacation/sightseeing as the taxi fare is 40-60 TL one way to get to most of the tourist sites. Also, there is little in the way of shopping/eating close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hazineh
Reviews.Content: nothing to be too excited about. pretty basic, although AC in room needs to be upgraded. good f&b at the hotel, value for money. beware, internet service is not that great in the rooms, but great in the lobby and public areas. proximity to the airport does affect your sleeping at night.

Reviews.Title: “Roadside Motel”
Reviews.Author: marcshiman
Reviews.Content: My company booked me into this hotel, and from the pictures it looked very nice to have such a facility (5-star) near the airport. The (free) shuttle came quickly, and the driver was helpful and professional. It was a bit disappointing when I arrived. The hotel is literally 3 meters from a major (heavily trafficked) highway, complete with sirens and horns. Between this and the nearby airport, its a fairly noisy place. The building is basically a box-like motel, with uninspiring rooms. The Radisson Blu label suggests a chic lobby with a fancy bar and a big zen sand garden for a courtyard, but from a functional perspective, its bland. The outrage is in the mini-bar: $8 for a seven-up? Seriously? No problem, walk outside to the gas station a block away and you can get drinks at a reasonable price - but you are taking your life into your hands doing it as cars come screaming in on all sides around. This hotel is an island and the management knows it - hence mini-bar prices that would make management at the Ritz-Carlton in Paris blush. Wifi is free and during the day it is fast fast. During the evening, the network becomes a not-work. Pages wouldn't load (basic Yahoo pages) and it was basically impossible to use. The bed is firm and very nice. A good sleep experience. The bathroom is as basic as they come with amenities that certainly don't tempt you to take the rest home. I visited the gym, and there is a lot of cardio equipment there - although with all the angles and mirrors in the place it became a bit disorienting. I didn't see the pool. Room service provided me with a $20 meal on a gigantic plate with a tiny little portion in the center. If you have a quick turnaround on a flight, this would definitely be a good place to spend a night assuming it fits in your budget. But if you have 24 hours in Istanbul or more - there are much better options.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel near Istanbul, Turkey Airport”
Reviews.Author: monishahuja
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two days at this hotel and its like a good decent hotel close to the airport at Istanbul. The proximity to the airport and free pick up and drop every 30 minutes make it a confortable place to stay in Istanbul. The hotel offers a nice spa,gym and swimming facility with a good restaurant and quality food service. The staff is courteous and it gives a good business feel to the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and practical”
Reviews.Author: Vinay_Rotti
Reviews.Content: I had been on a short business trip. Since time was of essence, we wanted something that was quite close to the Airport, comfortable and spacious. Radisson was the natural choice at Istanbul. The hotel is very conveniently located, just under 25mins from the Airport, The rooms are extremely spacious and offer a very good view of the International Airport, where in one can see the flights land and take off from the room. The staff at the front desk and the Restaurants were very courteus and friendly. The food is one of the biggest attraction when you visit a different culture and we were treated to some wonderful local delicacy. Overall, staying at the Radisson made the while trip a very enjoyable and comfortable experience, which showed positive results in the Business as well. I have already decided and announced that all our future Business Stays in Istanbul will be at the Radisson Blu, Conference Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight stay, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: sb1099
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a business class suite at this hotel at the very end of our trip on the night before we flew back home. This is a typical airport hotel with nice beds, bland decor, decent buffet, business like service, overpriced minibar. It served our purpose well enough - it was close to the airport, and we slept well. We did not take the shuttle to the airport even thought they were willing to wait for us a few minutes while we checked out, the taxi was inexpensive enough. We would not use this as a base for exploring Istanbul though.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: MontrealSunseeker
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I am a frequent traveller and always come to this website when going anywhere either for buisness or pleasure. I rarely feel the need to write reviews because I generally tend to agree with the majority of reviewers but this time I had a rather different experience than the majority. We booked this hotel because this was the site of my husband's work conference, so I was a bit wary about booking this hotel, particularly after reading the reviews. Well... to my immense surprise and great pleasure, I loved this hotel! And after talking to other conference attendees, all appeared to share the same sentiment. Regarding the look of the hotel, I was expecting some old shabby looking lobby. Instead, what I got, was an ultra-modern, minimalist looking lobby in tones of black, white and red. The lobby couches were very comfortable and not at all dreary. Our rooms were quite large, very clean and had all the modern amenities one could want from a 5-star hotel. My only complaint was the rock hard mattress. In all, while this hotel doesn't reflect a traditional ottoman furnishing, it was crisp, impeccably clean and elegant Regarding the shuttle bus, yes its true there is only a shuttle every hour, but while I was waiting for the shuttle at the airport (and by the way, it always arrived on time) I also noticed the schedule for all the other airport hotels shuttles, including the Courtyard, Holiday Inn and the Sheraton and they also had ourly shuttles, so no difference there. We did the trip into the Old Town 4 times with public transport, and yes it took us over an hour to get there, but public transport is safe and easy and in rush hour traffic it may actually beat a taxi ride. Breakfast was another pleasant surprise. The choice was plentiful and varied. This included about 8 different types of breakfast breads, pastries, cakes, yogurt (with various toppings), an egg station serving made-to-order omelets, scrambled and hard-boiled eggs, various fruits and vegetables, french toast, pankakes and traditional turkish items. In short, they had something to suit any palate. The pool and gym were somewhat dissapointing and were rather dark and unwelcoming, but they still contained the basic amenities of any gym. I would go back in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy and unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: Spadina2
Reviews.Content: The lobby and my room were dreary, dingy and uncomfortable. Front desk staff were unco-operative and inflexible in dealing with a problem. They claim to have an airport shuttle but it does not appear to exist. To catch the purported 6 pm shuttle I stood at the front entrance with the bellman from 10 till until 10 past 6 and it didn't show up. They had the gall to tell me I had missed it. I kicked up such a fuss they paid for a cab. It is very expensive given its mediocrity.

Reviews.Title: “Basics, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Passrider
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for two weeks for a business trip. The company I was visiting booked the hotel for me, so I didn't know anything about it beforehand. In general, it provides basic 5 star hotel services: wireless internet (both in the room and in the lobby), clothes cleaning services and meals. The location, as has been stated by others on this website, is adjacent to the airport. This means that it is quite a way away from city center. There are only two very simple restaurants withing walking distance. However the walk to them is quite dangerous as you need to use the shoulders of the major highway (no sidewalk) to get to them. The restaurant in the hotel is quite expensive (nothing new there) and they don't vary the menu. This means you tire of the cuisine after the first day or two. Breakfast is served buffet style but again, no variation from day to day. The hotel offers a pool, but it is barely more than a oversized hot tub, without the jetting water. In all, the hotel is suitable for short, overnight stays...nothing more

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Even if it was for only a few hours”
Reviews.Author: Pap
Reviews.Content: We had an eight hour stopover in Istanbul on a very tiring sequence of flights so decided to disregard some of the recent reviews on Tripadvisor; anywhere to get our heads down would be fine and the airport hotel doesn't allow dogs. This hotel was the next nearest we could find. The taxi driver had a problem finding the place - the sign wasn't lit; something of a worry. However, once we found the place the staff were friendly and efficient. The room was large and well appointed. Everything was clean. We were not affected at all by airplane noise - despite it being at the approach end of the active runway - and got the sleep we needed. Checkout was fast, friendly and efficient. Two small compalints. First was the outdoor sign being unlit making it difficult to find. Second was the vey complicated route from the lobby to our room - something to do with the ongoing renovation.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY, UNFRIENDLY and VERY EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: tneedham
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again. First off the hotel looks over a 12 lane motorway and is situated at the end of istanbul airport's runway. If you dare to take a walk (there are no walkways, you have to risk your life on the side of the motorway) you are very unlikely to find anything interesting to see, its situated in a bit of a slum area, there are quite a few small friendly 'family run' stores in the back streets that sell water and beer for 1/10th of the hotels prices. Great for plane spotting as they take off over the roof of the hotel, but sleepless nights are not my cup of tea My first night i had very little sleep, after complaining I was moved from, in thier own words: 'the noisy side' to 'the quieter side'. It may have been quieter or it may have been that the new room's aircon drowned out the aircraft noise? The room is very expensive for whet you get, and the bar/restaurant is very expensive too. I found the Gym to be very uninviting as was the hotel in general. The overall feeling is very cold, dark and unfriendly. The only thing going for it is that its (almost too) close to the airport. and judging by the number of business suites, it may be good for a conference or two. I am writing this from my room at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a stopover - or late-arrival - not more”
Reviews.Author: Munich_guy
Reviews.Content: Have been there 5 years ago already, for stopover on a travel from Asia to Europe with Turkish Airlines - and liked the place very much at the time. Location is very close to the airport, with shuttle service to/from airport (from where a subway goes to town. Next to airport and next to a highway obviously means this is no "holiday hotel", but for someone planning for a 2-night stopover, and taking advantage of the shuttle to/from airport (and one day to see the highlights of the in town), it is a good and reasonably priced option. At the time the health club was excellent - this time I did not have time to go there, as I arrived late evening, and transferred to our office on the next morning. My Impression was that general maintenance (rooms, etc.) has been so so ... Internet access worked fine and breakfast is still a highlight - but I had a fly falling into my milk for coffee - just added to the "so so" impression. Generally my prime reason for staying at the hotel was late arrival and then transfer next morning ... for this purpose hotel is still a quite reasonable option, for anyone staying several days in Istanbul on holiday - beyond stop-over, it is quite far out (1 hour + transit one-way) and certainly staying somewhere downtown is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enormous suite, US style, but warning for the restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: BizLeisureFred
Reviews.Content: As we needed to catch a plane in the early morning hours, we decided to stay one night at this hotel after a week in central Istanbul. The hotel is very spacious and we were given an enormous suite with much, much space for our family of five. It felt as if you were in the States, but the rooms were not feeling totally clean regretfully. The reception and bar area has undergone renovation and felt extremely hip and trendy. Like any airport-near hotel, you have nothing in the neighbourhood and we simply had to eat at the hotel. The club sandwiches two of us took were from the fridge and the food were a clear disappointment given how well we've eaten in Istanbul for much smaller money during our week there. Breakfast in the morning looked impressive, but wasn't after all as those of us having scrambled eggs caught a bad stomach infection coming home (the ones not having the eggs did not get it). Even though the price was reasonable, especially given the size of the suite, you would not return after that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for Stopovers”
Reviews.Author: Naminator
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated 10 minutes by car from Ataturk International Airport. The hotel offers a free of charge transport every hour from the airport to the hotel and back. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The service staff was very friendly. The interior of the hotel is very modern. The hotel is also very quiet and you can't hear starting or arriving planes.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be ripped off and have a bad night sleep â€“ go there.”
Reviews.Author: GT350R
Reviews.Content: If you want to be ripped off and have a bad night sleep â€“ go there. Check-in: in the lobby it was so dark that it was not possible to read the chieck-in form. Room: normal standard for this type of hotel EXECT the noise. First I thought that the window was open, hotel is placed right under the takeoff strip, plans going full throttle every 5 minutes. When it was not the planes you heard the freeway and the lobby. Planes where staring at this schedule until 1AM, little fewer planes during the night then the same schedule from early morning. Minibar â€“ if you wanted a can o Carlsberg that was â€œonlyâ€� 8 EUR (Pay TV = 15 EUR 12 hours â€“ often wonder who uses this now days ?). The free WiFi was free but I got thrown out 5 times during my 1 night stay, the WiFi was not that fast. Location: is nothing to see (stores, restaurants, etc) at walking distance, if you are not interested of counting cars on the freeway. Breakfast: final rip off - 18 EUR !!!! Free airport shuttle: yeaa right â€“ leaves only every hour. Lucky enough taxi fare to/from the airport is only 5 to 8 EUR. Last - when I checked out the two employees where have a nice conversation whit each other in Turkish â€“ during the hole check out procedure. Not paying their customer much attention. So do yourself a favor â€“ take a longer taxi fare and stay at a more central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you need a layover at the airport”
Reviews.Author: bjornstrom
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of connecting flights coming in late to Ataturk/IST and leaving early. Paying around â‚¬140 per night for a average hotel room with no air conditioning (central heating/cooling) and no breakfast. Beds are rock hard and not comfy. Got a non-smoking room but when I came into the room I got that familiar "smokers smell". Wifi is working fine despite other Tripadvisor reports (for me at least) and it's free. Breakfast is â‚¬20 so I'll eat in the lounge tomorrow. I was lucky to find a empty shuttle bus when I arrived so I got here very easy and free. It leaves once per hour - on the hour - from the hotel. In-room minibar is expensive and so is room service. Would only recommend this hotel to someone who needs one night at the airport as a layover - and I suspect that there are better hotels than this (at the actual airport - this is 5 kilometers away). Not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Near airport - but ridiculous in-house costs !!”
Reviews.Author: C-for
Reviews.Content: I spent last night at this hotel in Istanbul - - previously called the Radisson SAS Airport and Conference Centre, now the Radisson BLU Airport and Conference Hotel. Well â€“ what to say ? Those who have read my Hotel comments from around the World know I am commonly upbeat and positive (!). The â€œCatâ€� always tries to be positive ! OK - - let me start with the positives. It is very near the Istanbul (Aratuk) airport. Apart for the actual hotel within the airport â€“ it must be the closest. It is a 10 minute (max) taxi ride for 5 Euros (7 max). So if like me â€“ you are here for only 20 hours and do not savour the prospect of the plastic and metal chairs in Istanbul airportâ€¦.I rest my case ! My room (101) is lovely. Very spacious, plasma TV with 30 channels (2-3 English, including BBC World service), massive king size bed (all for me !), pillows to die for â€“ sooo soft!, air con (that does not seem to work â€“ but it is cold here; so maybe on â€œheatâ€� permanently ?), utterly spotless including bathroom, iron and iron table, fridge, kettle (cups and free tea/coffee/whitener), mood lighting (low if you want and plenty of light to work by if required). AND a major plus - - a massive window that opens wide for fresh air !!. Lovely ! All staff I met â€“ concierge, check-in and restaurant were most courteous and welcoming. Nice. I have seen comments on this hotel about aircraft noise. I think my room is more to the back of the hotel - - so apart from the odd distant rumble of aircraft - the only noise is the local kids kicking a football around in a nearby park.. And the Iman of the local Mosque â€“ singing (rather badly !) at various hours through a Tannoy. But to me that is fun ! Ah wellâ€¦. Now for the not so good: 1. The hotel should inform guests the pick-up times and locations of their (free) shuttle bus at the Airport. I stood for 40 minutes on the footpath outside the airport in a general Hotel Shuttle bus pick-up zone, before a local man (for a 1 Euro tip) told me - â€œOh that bus never comesâ€� (!) And got me a local (yellow) taxi â€“ for a 7 Euro fare to the hotel ! 2. Then â€“ honestlyâ€¦ I am paying 150 Euros for one night in here. In no way is it worth that. The Hotel is situated right next to a 12 lane highway (airport and through roads), next to a grubby local shopping area [selling what my dear father would have termed â€œtattâ€�]. There is no way you would chose to stay here apart for airport-access expediency ! Maybe 90 Euros â€“ no more. Do not consider this for a romantic getaway !! 3. To add to the cost - the mini bar prices are nothing short of diabolical ! One example â€“ one 500 ml bottle of water is 2.50 Euros !! I walked next door (walk out hotel front door and go right for 100 metres) to the Shell service station. And bought 2 x 1.5 litre bottles of chilled water and 1 small can of Coke for 1.75 Euros !! By the way - - that service station has all sorts of choccie bars and nibbles, too ! At local (realistic) prices ! 4. Oh â€“ as previously reported - the WiFi in the rooms is AWFUL. It cuts out every 30 seconds. It is quite unusable in the room ! I seriously complained about this on departure. Go to the large foyer area (lobby level) and it works fine ! 5. I ate dinner at the restaurant in the hotel. WOW ! On the one hand â€“ the risotto with grilled veg and soft white cheese was truly beautiful (10 Euros). BUT to pay 8 Euros for a small bottle of local beer !!! They really have rocks in their head. Utter rip-off. Now I know why the waiter could not find the drinks menu !!! Not his fault. But Radisson management really have to consider these ridiculous prices ! To sum upâ€¦ If you really need to stay near Istanbul airport for one night. OK. Any more â€“ no way. If you want to eat and drink in this hotel (without negotiating an additional bank loan) â€“ forget it ! The Cat..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Turquoise2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. Arrived late, were greeted nicely. The room was spacious. They put an extra bed for our kid. In the morning, breakfast was superb. We loved the decoration of the breakfast room. The free shuttle service took us back to the airport. It was an excellent hotel for us overall. If you are traveling with kids and if you need to stay for a night near the airpot, this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night - if you do not consume anything...”
Reviews.Author: Stijn-nederland
Reviews.Content: It is an airport hotel; thus not recommended to stay more then 1 night, for sure there are better airport hotels in the neighberhood. However they claim to be a business hotel so we stayed 6 nights... The hotel is just at the end of the starting track; the airplanes are flying with full throttle only meters above the hotel. Unfortunately the sound insulation very poor. Airplane noise in the lobby, restaurant and room (take-off even after midnight)! The bar in the lobby is trendy orange so are the prices too (11 euro for beer, 9 euro cola, simple longdrink more then 20 euros). The breakfast buffet is good (about 20 euros) The restaurant is much too expensive related to quantitiy and quality. However there is a good Turkish restaurant on the same road (a road with 12 lanes!) about 1 minute walking direction Istanbul; the foodcost is there about 1/5 of that of the hotel. The mini-bar you better don't touch: cola 6 euro, mineral water 3 euro, snicker 5 euro, bier 33cl 8 euro. However behind the hotel there is a small town with small shops. There is no airconditioning in the room. It is a centralized system, whether the airco controller in the room is on 15Â° or 30Â°C; the air-heat what you get is for everybody the same. Upon complaints of being much too hot in the room they say: switch off the vent in your room. Note that there is no other means of fresh air in the room (no natural ventilation, no window can be opened). What is good on the hotel? - lodged in "A" part of the hotel and that means new furnished rooms. - you can see the passengers in the airplane waving to you after take-off when you are outside. - all drinks and foods are so expensive that for sure you will loose some weight even without going to the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Threadbare to say the least”
Reviews.Author: Luftigallus
Reviews.Content: Although we had booked a non-smoking room with kingsize bed they wanted to give us a smoking room which smelled like an ashtray. The room had cigarette burns everywhere on the carpet and on the furniture. Staff was very helpful to change the room which was not much better safe the smell. Very run down furniture and mouldy bathroom. The rooms are really big and spacey, shame about the upkeeping! Staff is helpful and friendly. All in all its convenient if you stay just for a night, very close to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson SAS in the dark”
Reviews.Author: Navigator51
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Radisson SAS hotels over the years and always been impressed. Sadly the Radisson SAS Blue at Istanbul airport is not one of them. Had a one night stopover, so the good points - the hotel is very close to the airport and the hotel shuttle is clean and easy leaves the International terminal at 30 minutes past the hour and on the hour from the hotel from 06.00AM. No fuss, on time, clean and free. Maybe I had a bad room - which was old and serious need of refurbishment. small old style TV, burn marks on carpet, hard uncomfortable bed (nice pillows though). Very tired bathroom with cracked, dirty tiles, chipped paint, old and very worn towels (clean but grey), a DIY paint job and only one low power light bulb!! On that point, low power light bulbs in the room and throughout the hotel give everything a dark and rather sad appearance. Putting in some decent lighting would greatly improve the overall impression. There is free wi-fi in the room but it is so slow to be almost not useable. It is a little faster in the lobby. OK, there is quite a lot of airplane noise, but it is an airport hotel. However, other places seem to cope much better with sound insulation. The lobby area follows the low calorie lighting theme and the bar is well... a very lurid 70's style Orange! Nice bar staff, but then with the high cost of drinks, I'm not sure if they are just a bit bemused at charging such high prices to visitors they probably will not see again. There is a restaurant but beware that breakfast does not start until 06.30AM so not much good if you have an early flight. There is not even an option to grab a quick coffee. I like the Radisson SAS brand, but this place falls well short of the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Not so expensive for Istanbul 5 star airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: chesterwaverly
Reviews.Content: We were coming through Istanbul for one night on our way from the U.S. to Central Asia - and the Rad had the best deal online that we could find on relatively short notice. I'll be brief in my thoughts, and I'll start with the negatives. Negatives: 1) The restaurant is too expensive - but it's an airport hotel. What do you expect? 2) The bathrooms have a weird shower guard - it only covers half the bath - I didn't like this as it meant the floor was a swimming pool after my shower. 3) They need to give the reception folks a refresher course on English. Some spoke English just fine, but we had a few who were really struggling. 4) The water in the bathtub was dirty. But it was just after an 11 hour flight, and I really needed a bath, and so I hopped in anyhow. 5) Had trouble with the internet, but it might because I use a Mac. It was working fine, and then I lost it and couldn't get it back. But I called down and they quickly brought me an ethernet cable so I could get back on. Positives: 1) The shuttle bus was timely and helpful. 2) The front desk staff were efficient and reliable. 3) The room was clean and cozy. I had no problem with the proximity to the airport. In fact, I appreciated it the next morning when we had to get there quickly. 4) Even though the restaurant was pricy, the buffet was quite tasty (love that baklahva!) Plus, our kids ate for free! And for breakfast (which was a crazy 18 pounds for a buffet) they let my kids eat free without me eating too. They certainly didn't eat 18 pounds worth - just a bowl of cereal each. It would be nice if they gave a continental breakfast option and included it with the room booking. 5) Seemed to have a nice fitness area - and although we missed out on the swimming pool (again, a language issue - we thought we had more time than we had - it closes at 10 PM), it looked nice, but small. 6) Checkout had a couple of hiccups - a few charges for things we didn't think we should be charged for - but the front desk staff was great about fixing those issues. And then they went out and found us the two taxis we needed to get back to the airport as we couldn't wait for the shuttle (which runs from the hotel on the hour). Overall, the positives outweigh the negatives. It is a fine place for an overnighter when you aren't looking to see the city. Obviously, if you want to actually see Istanbul, you could do much better by going into the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Serious rip off”
Reviews.Author: Sakko
Reviews.Content: This is the most serious rip off we have come across. If you need anything to eat or drink the prices are 3-5 times normal Istanbul prices. One very simple dinner more than doubled the price of our stay. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but a bit noisy around”
Reviews.Author: KestutisKisielis
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself, service, rooms was very good. But near is speedway, also you can see near airport and lifting up airplanes that makes high noise. Also at 5:30 at morning you will be wake up because of muslim mosgue and prays from speakers on minarets. But it is not expencive and nice inside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: elastkinguk
Reviews.Content: A first class hotel offering all nevessary facilities. All staff are extremely polite and nothing is too much trouble for any of them - it is a pleasure to stay here and I would recommend it to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Experience”
Reviews.Author: Burzin
Reviews.Content: The people were downright RUDE at the check in counter. First they did not give us the rate we saw on the internet, then they refused to give us breakfast which was included in the rate on the internet and offered us a "GRAB and GO", the meaning of which we only understood the next morning. The place is close to a restaurant down the road but getting there means risking life and limb on the Highway. When we were checking out, the only thing to grab was an apple, which when we were grabbing the bus driver decided to leave with our bags in the bus before the appointed time. When he was called back, we were actually chided for delaying the bus whilst we were stuffing our faces. Truly PATHETIC experience. Only worth going if you are stuck in the hotel because of some corporate asissgnment and someone else is paying. NOT suitable for children or holiday goers.

Reviews.Title: “nice looking, noisy location, daylight robbers”
Reviews.Author: TRAXUK
Reviews.Content: Arranged for them to pick me up from the airport (they quoted 40 Lira on the phone - $25). Got smoky old Toyota though, not nice. hotel looks okay on the inside - the rooms are quite good too - I had a remodelled room, it was comfortable. My room was next to the freeway and traffic all night - kept me awake - not good. When i went to check out - they charged me 100 lira ($65) for the airport pickup (taxi is 10 lira - so ten times the amount). I was extremely angry - they told me it was 40 EURO (plus 7 Euro tax) for the pickup, not 40 LIRA. Their bill was in Lira, so why they quote me Euros anyway? On a trip earlier in the week I got a brand new Mercedes S320 for $25 from a hotel - not a smoky old toyota for $63 bucks! Will never stay there again. Had to stay here another night so I have moved to the Polat Renaissance Airport Istanbul - much better (and they upgraded my room!)

Reviews.Title: “What a dump...”
Reviews.Author: B777av8r
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living and have been to most corners of this globe and have stayed in some very good and some very poor hotels. The Radisson SAS rates as one of the WORST places that I have ever stayed in my life. The illusion you get, when walking into the lobby, is one of cleanliness and some grandeur. Thats where the illusion ends and reality sets in. First off, the carpets in this place are filthy. They are so dirty that all you need do is walk on them once with a pair of white socks and you turn the socks brown. It must have been the turn of the century since they were last cleaned. The curtains haven't seen the inside of a washing machine for ages, either. There are controls for the air conditioning. The fan turns on and you are greeted with the noise of an airplane and/or a blast of hot air, that cannot be controlled. Forget trying to open a window. You can't. The hotel advertises internet. You can send a letter in the mail faster than what their system will send. As per other readers and the prices of food, VERY expensive and no service at all. The health club is mediocre at best. There are numerous treadmills and good brand exercise machines. No maintenance is done on them, so be aware of faulty equipment. The good part? The MetroBus to downtown and connections to the train is right out the door. If you want to go out and have a nice dinner that is priced right and enjoy what Istanbul really has to offer, go downtown. I'm just glad that my vaccinations are up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for airport layovers”
Reviews.Author: Carpinteria
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked at the poor reviews that this hotel has received. I travel a LOT (over a hundred hotel nights a year, always in 4- and 5-star properties). I believe that this hotel is good value for the money, the staff is exceptionally helpful, and the proximity to the airport (with free shuttle) makes it perfect for an overnight stay between flights. One serious caveat: I originally booked a two-level suite, which was huge, but it fronts the highway, and I am very sensitive to noise. I immediately switched to a room with an interior view (to an atrium), and that room was extremely quiet and very well-appointed. Breakfast, which was included in my rate, was excellent. Again, hotel service was fine. I wouldn't book this hotel UNLESS you were merely stopping over (for an overnight connection) or unless you had a conference scheduled to meet there -- it is simply not convenient to the city or other touristic attractions. However, for either of the two aforementioned purposes (transient or in-hotel conference), I'd book it again in a heartbeat. DO keep in mind that some rooms are noisy, while others are incredibly quiet. For hotels I don't know (or that don't know me), I usually call the day of arrival and "negotiate" my room, so that it is blocked and all of my persona preferences are addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellentravels
Reviews.Content: This sounded like a good hotel near the airport and the rooms were nice, however the only restaurant here is very over-priced. I paid $16 for a bowl of onion soup and $14 for a small bottle of San Pelligrino water. This doesn't include the 10% service charge and the 16% tax. A boring over-priced airport hotel. Look elsewhere. I've stayed in fabulous airport hotels ( Bangkok), but this was a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for dayuse”
Reviews.Author: FrequenTraveller26
Reviews.Content: I preferred hotel because of the proximity to airport, I stayed 11:00 to 18:00 o`clock and I paid only 75 euro. Hotel also has free shuttle service from and to airport in every 30 minutes. Hotel was nice and staff were very helpful.Wireless internet was free, I recommend everyone especially for traveller who stay for short time.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: AMY3
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during a business trip. The hotel was very comfortable and all the staff was very friendly. It is good that they are offering free shutte to city. This was great when you are also staying during the weekend. The room was very cleand and comfortable. Free wireless was also avaliable everywhere. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pen-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 7 nights. They gave me a quiet superior room for standard price. Huge room with very comfortable king sized bed, large business desk, nice couches, water cooker, coffee, tea, 2 bottels of water /day and free Pay-TV. Hotel has a small fitness area. Swimming pool and sauna were free. There are several training machines as well. Fast enough free WLAN available. Hotel restaurant offers international meal for fair price. Since I could not enjoy typical Turkish meal, I loved this hotel restaurant. Hotel personal were very friendly and helpful. Negative matters: Since the hotel locates beside airport and motorway, you should better ask a quiet room. Breakfast is costly. (12 Eur) No shuttle bus between the hotel and the airport. (less than 10 min by Taxi: 6-8 Eur)

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: gorki
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I have been there already 3 times on business and my last stay was there in March and everything was perfect as always. All the staff extraordinary helpful and friendly. They made you feel very special. It's very close to airport and so convenient for early morning flights. The most important thing is for me that Internet connection. It's complimentary in the hotel even in the room. The rooms are huge, comfortable and clean. The only bad things is that Healt Club is close at 10 pm and if you finish your work late you have no time to relax there before go sleep. For business travelers it's definetely more than recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Internet Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: mongolia34
Reviews.Content: Nice Rooms and absolutely MISERABLE INTERNET CONNECTION! For an international chain in one of the most prominent cities in the history of western civilization, the internet is RIDICULOUS.

Reviews.Title: “Soul-numbingly bleak”
Reviews.Author: Terribleman
Reviews.Content: How this dreary barn won a 2001 "Design and Renovation award" is beyond me. Okay - no one stays in an airport hotel for fun. It's the 4am check-in that brings us here - but I have stayed in numerous comfortable, friendly, sometimes charming, occasionally stylish airport hotels. This is not any of the above. The exterior is the standard squat, internationalist architecture - but not immediately giving a sense of foreboding. Once through the revolving door, howeverâ€¦ No architect - even in the dim recesses of the 1970s -could have thought this soulless atrium, devoid of style, ornamentation, colour, anything, an appropriate lobby. The central bar, a pair of wooden tiki huts seemed laughably out of place. The (polite) receptionist could not find my reservation, but having done so placed me in a twin-room (I had specifically asked for a king), the bell-hop had me movedâ€¦ Service is - at best - desultory. The shop was closed and would reopen "in an hour or so", in the meantime I was advised that I could get what I needed "in the gas station down the road". The airport shuttle mentioned on their website no longer runs - I don;t mind paying for a cab, but it would be nice to know. And what kind of airport hotel doesn't run a shuttle - after all, they run one to their sister hotel in downtown Istanbul. Breakfast is from 6.30 (a little pointless when your check-in is at 6) and the bar and restaurant for this captive audience is grotesquely expensive. On the plus side, the staff are courteous, the room is spacious (though the beige with orange tubular furniture recalls a 70s office), and the Wi-Fi free (though confusingly the note in the room says it has to be paid for). If proximity is the issue, stay in the airport hotel inside the International Terminal, if not, stay in Sultanahmet and get an early cab, but whatever you do, avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Don't make the same mistake as me!”
Reviews.Author: tonyjane
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, simply as I needed to be at the airport for a 0535 flight. The fact it was a Radisson attracted me, as I am not a frequent user of the chain, prefrerring Marriott every time, so I gave it a go. BIG Mistake. I paid Â£105 for a standard room, which is not particularly cheap, expecting a 5 star experience. If this is 5 star it is in breach of Trade Descriptions. Here are my experiences; 1. The receptionist checked me in, but never stopped talking on the phone while he did it. 2. The Hotel is on a motorway (Yes DIRECTLY on a motorway), with nothing either side of it but a Shell garage. 3. The room was dated, drab and dirty. There were cigarette burns in the carpet (This was a Non smoking room!), the fabric of the desk chair was worn and stitched together, and the beds were about one foot of the ground, with pillows (sorry, pillow) about 3 inches thick. They were single (and I mean single) beds. The last time I slept in a bed like this was in my Mums house when I had my own room for the first time and a handed down bed from my sister! I had just come from the Marriott Amman, a double room there consists of two DOUBLE beds, with 4 very large pillows per bed, and even a two inch thick mattress protector. 4. They gave me one room key. This key also operates the room safe. Problem is, it also operates the lights. Guess what. When you take the key from the holder by the door, the lights go out. So you can't see the safe to open it. Therefore you must get someone to hold open the door to shine in some light, take the key from the holder 'click' off go the lights, and then try to find what you want from your dark abyss. 5. The bathroom was horrible. Everyone likes a nice clean hotel bathroom. Two pet hates of mine are brown discoloured grout/Sealant, and no plug in the sink, just a black hole full of previously spat toothpaste and hair. This room had both. Why no plug in the sink of a 5 star hotel? 6. Lastly, and this is the big one. PRICES PRICES PRICES. Are they kidding!!! Exchange rate was YTL1.70 to 1 Euro. My minibar was priced as follows Local beer 12 YTL (7 euro or Â£5 GBP for 33cl) Whiskey 25 YTL (15 euro or Â£10 GBP for 5cl Peanuts 20 YTL (12 euro or Â£8 GBP for PEANUTS!!!!!!) The bar downstairs was priced even higher, so two small beers would set me back twenty quid!!. Stuff it, I took a cab to the nearest supermarket, bought 6 cans of 50 cl beer, some crisps and peanuts and chocolate, and came back. The cost including a return cab fare - 25 euro. I got all this and the cab ride for the same price as two 33cl beers from my minibar. You get the picture!! It seems that its remote location is deliberate to make you spend excessively as a captive. The disgruntled look i got from the security guard as I passed through the scanner and was searched seemed also to suggest this. ; "Not good - outside food - not good OK go! ") Lastle, there is a selection of shops in the hotel. I passed by slowly looking in the windows, when suddenly a deranged man leapt at me, dragging me towards his wares. "Come you must look, come!!!." When I refused he followed me from his shop, into the reception, shouting virtual abuse at my lack of interest. I had to scuttle away looking behind me to see he was gone. Good 5 star hotel experience eh! Friend and fellow travellers, I eat sleep and breath travel, planes hotels taxis restaurants for business and leisure, so please believe me this is one grotty dump, if you want to be relieved of a few hundred quid for an overnight stay with a meal (in the ONE restaurant - don't like Italian - tough!), go ahead, or do as I will do next time guys, stay some place else. AVOID. Oh, the noise from the planes, you are probably 400m from the end of the runway.........

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bedroom”
Reviews.Author: pilski
Reviews.Content: Having just stayed at the wonderful Radisson SAS Bosphorus, I moved to the airport hotel to ensure I could catch an early flight in the morning (the traffic in Istanbul is terrible). Reception staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. The decor is dated and dingy, but the worst aspect was the bedroom. I can put up with dated decor and furntiure, but not with uncleanliness. There were dirty marks on the mirrored wardrobes, the bathroom floor had splash marks, the tiles were dirty and ring marks on the washbasin surround. The only good point I can find is the queue of taxi's outside the hotel to get me away from the place.

Reviews.Title: “Return Year after Year”
Reviews.Author: joellakuck
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for two nights in transit either side of our trip to Ipsala, Edirne for the last 4 years. We find it very convenient for picking up our Hire Car after our flight from the UK and continuing with our journey the next day. We are a family of four with two young children. We always book a Superior room which accomodates us all comfortably they are bright modern rooms with new bathrooms, Tea Coffee etc. We always find the staff very friendly, excellent with our children and extremely efficient. On our return journey the hotel car always gives us a lift to the airport. The only downside was the lack of outside space but this year we were pleased to find they had opened a garden at the rear of the hotel. We have stayed in other 5 star hotels in Istanbul and have found this hotel to be great if travelling with children.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Blu Conference & Airport Hotel, Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: E-5 Karayolu (Yanyol), No:20, Istanbul 34295, Turkey
